data.title: Small Anniversary Party
data.text: I  hosted a small anniversary party at this restaurant yesterday.  The service was exceptional from beginning to end.  The food was delicious and prepared as the guests requested.  When I made my reservations I made several special requests, all my requests were meet.

data.title: Food was ok, service not so good
data.text: Saturday night, my wife and I arrive at 630.  Seated right away.  Party going on but dining room is not overly busy.  Hostess seats us and gives us menus.  Waitress standing right behind her asks is we would like a drink.  I ask if she can come back in a few as we just sat and would like to look at the drink menu.  A little slow coming back to us, about 15 minutes, but we are in no rush.  I order an espresso martini. It was excellent.  Got the drinks pretty quick.  Order dinner and an App.  Waitress comes back about 20 minutes later and says she forgot to order App and Entrees will be out soon. Asks "do you want to skip the App"? Sure no problem.  1 minute later App shows up and 3 minutes after that Dinner!  She apologizes.  I have Tuscan Chicken, excellent.  Wife has Shrimp San Marino,  she says ok but too much sauce.  We order 2 glasses of wine and they arrive pretty quick.  After dinner its cappuccinos and we share a tiramisu. Almost done with  Cappuccino when dessert shows up.  More Apologies.  No offer of taking the dessert off the bill or an after dinner drink. Tiramisu tastes like a wet sponge.  Awful.  Too many other good restaurants to waste my time here.  Won't go back

data.title: Yum
data.text: Second time here.  Both times had eggplant parmigiana.  Why mess with perfection?  Only complaint is very loud.

data.title: Love It if no parties are goinh on
data.text: Food is great but it gets too loud when the restaurant has big parties going on.  Half walls separate the parties from walk in customers which doesn't help with the noise.   Seems that the customers are older and I didn't see one family with children as I sat and ate my dinner.  Don't understand because they do have a children's menu and plenty of room for families.  Families should try this restaurant.

data.title: Not too bad and that's good
data.text: Never ceases to amaze me that people can eat at the same place and get different views. Anyway, took old friend for Sunday dinner , I had the veal with prosciutto very good friend had some shrimp and cheese combo that looked good, DW had a pasta dish with asparagus sun dried tomatoes and artichokes . Two Big parties , but service was good and attentive . If you are in town go and enjoy.

data.title: Italian cusine
data.text: The food at San Marino is absolutely delicious!! From the appetizers to the entrees. Their chicken parm is so good!! They have home made pasta on the menu that is one of my favorites. I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. I have been dining there for years. I'm never disappointed!! Great family place! Recently renovated, very pretty. Great space for showers, parties, special occasions. Worth checking out!!

data.title: Probably our final visit
data.text: Very sorry to see what has happened to this place,  We waited some months; then revisited with a guest.  Clams casino were like leather with no flavor; pasta dish was unappetizing;  Broc raab had lots of uncut stalks; just not worth paying for.

data.title: Large portions, decent food, decent service
data.text: This is a large Italian restaurant with a welcoming atmosphere.  The appetizer platter had very good sausage, Broccoli Rabe and Mozzarella sticks...the calamari and arancini balls were average.   The sausage and peppers (long hots) were tasty with a decent kick.  For entree, I had the Scallops with risotto.  The risotto was cooked fairly well with plenty of vegetables mixed in, and the scallops, whilst cooked well, needed slightly better cleaning as I encountered some gritty bits (not enough to complain though).  The portion sizes were definitely 'American-sized', so we couldn't even look at dessert menu.  I recommend this for large gatherings, but not really a romantic night out because it's large and not very quiet.  The service is decent, but definitely not at the level of fine dining.

data.title: Italian in Waterbury
data.text:
This restaurant is open 7 days a week.   The atmosphere is very good. The place is very clean and the dining room is large. Staffed very well the servers and bar tenders are very attentive but not overwhelming. 
We enjoyed the menus that gave great selections of pasta fish chicken veal and beef. Something for everyone we enjoyed lasagna, a chicken special, and naked stuffed shrimp. All were perfect no complaints.   There are daily specials and even children's menus.  We would highly recommend this Italian restaurant.

data.title: Overall Very Good
data.text: I can't say the food or wine selection is great, but everything is in fact very good and at a reasonable price.  If you want above average selection, quality and price, this is the place to go.

data.title: Just allright
data.text: We went to celebrate my husband's retirement and we had to wait even though there were many empty tables. The fodd was just all right and not hot. We did not have bread plates and had to ask for utensils for dessert. Our server was Jake....not great...

data.title: Bistro Filet Grinder is the Best!
data.text:
Visited San Marino for a birthday lunch today.  Checked out the menu ahead of time and was interested in a few things.  Noticed the Bistro Filet Grinder and asked the waitress about it.  She described it as a prime cut of meat grilled and then sliced into a nice bun with cheese, mushrooms and onions; much nicer than a Philly SteakNCheese!  Wow!  She was right!  It came with Italian fries that were a bit soggy, but great anyway.  Huge, too, so I brought half home for dinner!

My wife got the Salmon Salad; a mediterranean style salad nicely dressed with artichokes and grilled salmon with just the right dressing.  Excellent.  

For desert, I tried the cannoli and it was excellent; not as good as the one I had in Italy garnished with candied lemon peel, but it was simple and not over done.

Service was excellent and waitress was very patient with us as we kept talking amongst ourselves and asked her a lot of questions.  She was observant and remembered we were there for birthdays, and they led a little song for us.

Very nice décor and good crowd for a Saturday afternoon.

Anxious to go again to try some of the other things on the menu.  Very professional operation.  They have a good thing going there.

data.title: Very good old school Italian
data.text: Really enjoyed San Marino.  It reminded me of Italian restaurants I visited as a kid. It was friendly and familiar.  The food was good, the atmosphere was better.  Great place to spend some time with old friends.

data.title: My go-to place
data.text: I go here all the time and even order take-out. Their angel hair puttanesca and salmon teggionese are both terrific. Excellent tiramisu and creme brulee. Not the best bread, and I'm not crazy about their bruschetta or sausage, but everything else I've had has been wonderful.

data.title: Ms
data.text: Went to San Marino's Saturday night - hsd a 7 Pm reservation - finally was seated at 7:30. Service was fair snd the food fair. I have been before and had great service and food-SO WHAT THE HECK HAPPENED ?????

data.title: Consistently good food at a good price.
data.text: A group of us always stop for dinner San Marino before going to the Palace Theater. The food is always consistently good and the service is prompt & friendly. Italian is the specialty and it is spot on. I love the Broccoli rabe for an appetizer & the mussels are another favorite. The potion size is just right. Check it out, you won't be sorry you did. The neighborhood is not an issue as alluded to in an earlier review.

data.title: Good Italian food, good prices
data.text: Popular place for parties.  San Marino offers a wide variety of italian food specialties.  Portions are larger,   Lot of families dine here as it's a good place for a crowd.  Has been around for a long time in Waterbury.   If the food wasn't good, they wouldn't survive.

data.title: Quality has been sliding for awhile . . .
data.text:
After a few visits since the remodel, we have decided to pass on this restaurant for awhile.  The quality of food has slipped; nothing drastic but just the little things here and there - clams casino formerly tender; have gotten tough; some dishes have lost the big tomatoes for a couple "grape tomatoes;"  chicken marsala that was 1/2 skin & bones (???); expresso without creme, tasted like warm old black coffee.

After shouting over the noise level for awhile, we finally decided that it just isn't worth the money.  Still a popular place, and will probably continue to be for a bunch of people having plenty of drinks and a "great time," but not a place you go for a peaceful evening out together.

We'll miss a formerly favorite spot but some other places offer better quality.

data.title: Never disappointing
data.text: A classic Italian restaurant in the waterbury area. The food here is excellent .. Never had a bad meal. The shrimp san marino is delicious!

data.title: Average Food/ Poor neighborhood
data.text: Big portions and ample seating make this Waterbury staple a still popular destination among old timers and families. But the bottom line is the area and surrounding parking lot is now a haven for petty crime and burglarizing. Gone is any old school "Italian Charm" as that has gone out the window with the recent redo of the decor and overall streamlining of a once vast menu with many specialty dishes held close to the heart of the Italian immigrants still living in the area. Kudos for trying to modernize but the end result has just further taken it away from what the place once was and still is, an average Italian restaurant. That being said, why go to an average Italian restaurant in a bad area and have your car window smashed in and get no apology from the owner or even get the police to show up.
